Description: Long wooden comb with a single set of 9 long large tapering teeth of which one is broken. The handle tapers towards each edge into which two pairs of pronounced notches have been cut. Both surfaces of the handle have decoration in the form of incised lines in a criss-cross pattern.
Curator's comments: S.-A. Ashton, 6,000 years of African combs (Cambridge: Fitzwilliam Museum), 16, fig. 14.
Exhibition history: 2013 July - October, Cambridge, The Fitzwilliam Museum, Origins of the Afro Comb
